intro: Lotononis eriocarpa, commonly known as the woolly lotononis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically visited by various pollinators. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in shrubland habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
